00026 string Token::AsString() const {
00027   switch (type_) {
00028   case IDENT:    return "'" + string(pos_, end_ - pos_) + "'";
00029   case UNKNOWN:  return "unknown '" + string(pos_, end_ - pos_) + "'";
00030   case NEWLINE:  return "newline";
00031   case EQUALS:   return "'='";
00032   case COLON:    return "':'";
00033   case PIPE:     return "'|'";
00034   case PIPE2:    return "'||'";
00035   case TEOF:     return "eof";
00036   case INDENT:   return "indenting in";
00037   case OUTDENT:  return "indenting out";
00038   case NONE:     break;
00039   }
00040   assert(false);
00041   return "";
00042 }

00044 bool SourceLocation::Error(const string& message, string* err) {
00045   char buf[1024];
00046   snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), "line %d, col %d: %s", line_, column_,
00047            message.c_str());
00048   err->assign(buf);
00049   return false;
00050 }

00052 void Tokenizer::Start(const char* start, const char* end) {
00053   cur_line_ = cur_ = start;
00054   end_ = end;
00055 }
00056 
00057 bool Tokenizer::Error(const string& message, string* err) {
00058   return Location().Error(message, err);
00059 }
00060 
00061 bool Tokenizer::ErrorExpected(const string& expected, string* err) {
00062   return Error("expected " + expected + ", got " + token_.AsString(), err);
00063 }
00064 
00065 void Tokenizer::SkipWhitespace(bool newline) {
00066   if (token_.type_ == Token::NEWLINE && newline)
00067     Newline(NULL);
00068 
00069   const char kContinuation = makefile_flavor_ ? '\\' : '$';
00070 
00071   while (cur_ < end_) {
00072     if (*cur_ == ' ') {
00073       ++cur_;
00074     } else if (newline && *cur_ == '\n') {
00075       Newline(NULL);
00076     } else if (*cur_ == kContinuation && cur_ + 1 < end_ && cur_[1] == '\n') {
00077       ++cur_; ++cur_;
00078       cur_line_ = cur_;
00079       ++line_number_;
00080     } else if (*cur_ == '#' && cur_ == cur_line_) {
00081       while (cur_ < end_ && *cur_ != '\n')
00082         ++cur_;
00083       if (cur_ < end_ && *cur_ == '\n') {
00084         ++cur_;
00085         cur_line_ = cur_;
00086         ++line_number_;
00087       }
00088     } else {
00089       break;
00090     }
00091   }
00092 }
00093 
00094 bool Tokenizer::Newline(string* err) {
00095   if (!ExpectToken(Token::NEWLINE, err))
00096     return false;
00097 
00098   return true;
00099 }
00100 
00101 static bool IsIdentChar(char c) {
00102   return
00103     ('a' <= c && c <= 'z') ||
00104     ('+' <= c && c <= '9') ||  // +,-./ and numbers
00105     ('A' <= c && c <= 'Z') ||
00106     (c == '_') || (c == '$') || (c == '\\');
00107 }
00108 
00109 bool Tokenizer::ExpectToken(Token::Type expected, string* err) {
00110   PeekToken();
00111   if (token_.type_ != expected)
00112     return ErrorExpected(Token(expected).AsString(), err);
00113   ConsumeToken();
00114   return true;
00115 }
00116 
00117 bool Tokenizer::ExpectIdent(const char* expected, string* err) {
00118   PeekToken();
00119   if (token_.type_ != Token::IDENT ||
00120       strncmp(token_.pos_, expected, token_.end_ - token_.pos_) != 0) {
00121     return ErrorExpected(string("'") + expected + "'", err);
00122   }
00123   ConsumeToken();
00124   return true;
00125 }
00126 
00127 bool Tokenizer::ReadIdent(string* out) {
00128   PeekToken();
00129   if (token_.type_ != Token::IDENT)
00130     return false;
00131   out->assign(token_.pos_, token_.end_ - token_.pos_);
00132   ConsumeToken();
00133   return true;
00134 }
00135 
00136 // A note on backslashes in Makefiles, from reading the docs:
00137 // Backslash-newline is the line continuation character.
00138 // Backslash-# escapes a # (otherwise meaningful as a comment start).
00139 // Backslash-% escapes a % (otherwise meaningful as a special).
00140 // Finally, quoting the GNU manual, "Backslashes that are not in danger
00141 // of quoting ‘%’ characters go unmolested."
00142 // How do you end a line with a backslash?  The netbsd Make docs suggest
00143 // reading the result of a shell command echoing a backslash!
00144 //
00145 // Rather than implement the above, we do the simpler thing here.
00146 // If anyone actually has depfiles that rely on the more complicated
00147 // behavior we can adjust this.
00148 bool Tokenizer::ReadToNewline(string *text, string* err, size_t max_length) {
00149   // XXX token_.clear();
00150   const char kContinuation = makefile_flavor_ ? '\\' : '$';
00151   while (cur_ < end_ && *cur_ != '\n') {
00152     if (*cur_ == kContinuation) {
00153       // Might be a line continuation; peek ahead to check.
00154       if (cur_ + 1 >= end_)
00155         return Error("unexpected eof", err);
00156       if (*(cur_ + 1) == '\n') {
00157         // Let SkipWhitespace handle the continuation logic.
00158         SkipWhitespace();
00159         continue;
00160       }
00161 
00162       // Otherwise, just treat it like a normal character.
00163       text->push_back(*cur_);
00164       ++cur_;
00165     } else {
00166       text->push_back(*cur_);
00167       ++cur_;
00168     }
00169     if (text->size() >= max_length) {
00170       token_.pos_ = cur_;
00171       return false;
00172     }
00173   }
00174   return Newline(err);
00175 }
00176 
00177 Token::Type Tokenizer::PeekToken() {
00178   if (token_.type_ != Token::NONE)
00179     return token_.type_;
00180 
00181   token_.pos_ = cur_;
00182   if (!makefile_flavor_ && cur_indent_ == -1) {
00183     cur_indent_ = cur_ - cur_line_;
00184     if (cur_indent_ != last_indent_) {
00185       if (cur_indent_ > last_indent_) {
00186         token_.type_ = Token::INDENT;
00187       } else if (cur_indent_ < last_indent_) {
00188         token_.type_ = Token::OUTDENT;
00189       }
00190       last_indent_ = cur_indent_;
00191       return token_.type_;
00192     }
00193   }
00194 
00195   if (cur_ >= end_) {
00196     token_.type_ = Token::TEOF;
00197     return token_.type_;
00198   }
00199 
00200   if (IsIdentChar(*cur_)) {
00201     while (cur_ < end_ && IsIdentChar(*cur_)) {
00202       ++cur_;
00203     }
00204     token_.end_ = cur_;
00205     token_.type_ = Token::IDENT;
00206   } else if (*cur_ == ':') {
00207     token_.type_ = Token::COLON;
00208     ++cur_;
00209   } else if (*cur_ == '=') {
00210     token_.type_ = Token::EQUALS;
00211     ++cur_;
00212   } else if (*cur_ == '|') {
00213     if (cur_ + 1 < end_ && cur_[1] == '|') {
00214       token_.type_ = Token::PIPE2;
00215       cur_ += 2;
00216     } else {
00217       token_.type_ = Token::PIPE;
00218       ++cur_;
00219     }
00220   } else if (*cur_ == '\n') {
00221     token_.type_ = Token::NEWLINE;
00222     ++cur_;
00223     cur_line_ = cur_;
00224     cur_indent_ = -1;
00225     ++line_number_;
00226   }
00227 
00228   SkipWhitespace();
00229 
00230   if (token_.type_ == Token::NONE) {
00231     token_.type_ = Token::UNKNOWN;
00232     token_.end_ = cur_ + 1;
00233   }
00234 
00235   return token_.type_;
00236 }
00237 
00238 void Tokenizer::ConsumeToken() {
00239   token_.Clear();
00240 }

00242 MakefileParser::MakefileParser() {
00243   tokenizer_.SetMakefileFlavor();
00244 }

00246 bool MakefileParser::Parse(const string& input, string* err) {
00247   tokenizer_.Start(input.data(), input.data() + input.size());
00248 
00249   tokenizer_.SkipWhitespace(true);
00250 
00251   if (!tokenizer_.ReadIdent(&out_))
00252     return tokenizer_.ErrorExpected("output filename", err);
00253   if (!tokenizer_.ExpectToken(Token::COLON, err))
00254     return false;
00255   while (tokenizer_.PeekToken() == Token::IDENT) {
00256     string in;
00257     tokenizer_.ReadIdent(&in);
00258     ins_.push_back(in);
00259   }
00260   if (!tokenizer_.ExpectToken(Token::NEWLINE, err))
00261     return false;
00262   if (!tokenizer_.ExpectToken(Token::TEOF, err))
00263     return false;
00264 
00265   return true;
00266 }

00268 ManifestParser::ManifestParser(State* state, FileReader* file_reader)
00269   : state_(state), file_reader_(file_reader) {
00270   env_ = &state->bindings_;
00271 }
00272 bool ManifestParser::Load(const string& filename, string* err) {
00273   string contents;
00274   if (!file_reader_->ReadFile(filename, &contents, err))
00275     return false;
00276   return Parse(contents, err);
00277 }
00278 
00279 bool ManifestParser::Parse(const string& input, string* err) {
00280   tokenizer_.Start(input.data(), input.data() + input.size());
00281 
00282   tokenizer_.SkipWhitespace(true);
00283 
00284   while (tokenizer_.token().type_ != Token::TEOF) {
00285     switch (tokenizer_.PeekToken()) {
00286       case Token::IDENT: {
00287         const Token& token = tokenizer_.token();
00288         int len = token.end_ - token.pos_;
00289         if (len == 4 && memcmp(token.pos_, "rule", 4) == 0) {
00290           if (!ParseRule(err))
00291             return false;
00292         } else if (len == 5 && memcmp(token.pos_, "build", 5) == 0) {
00293           if (!ParseEdge(err))
00294             return false;
00295         } else if ((len == 7 && memcmp(token.pos_, "include", 7) == 0) ||
00296                    (len == 8 && memcmp(token.pos_, "subninja", 8) == 0)) {
00297           if (!ParseFileInclude(err))
00298             return false;
00299         } else {
00300           string name, value;
00301           if (!ParseLet(&name, &value, err))
00302             return false;
00303           env_->AddBinding(name, value);
00304         }
00305         break;
00306       }
00307       case Token::TEOF:
00308         continue;
00309       default:
00310         return tokenizer_.Error("unhandled " + tokenizer_.token().AsString(), err);
00311     }
00312     tokenizer_.SkipWhitespace(true);
00313   }
00314 
00315   return true;
00316 }
00317 
00318 bool ManifestParser::ParseRule(string* err) {
00319   if (!tokenizer_.ExpectIdent("rule", err))
00320     return false;
00321   string name;
00322   if (!tokenizer_.ReadIdent(&name))
00323     return tokenizer_.ErrorExpected("rule name", err);
00324   if (!tokenizer_.Newline(err))
00325     return false;
00326 
00327   if (state_->LookupRule(name) != NULL) {
00328     *err = "duplicate rule '" + name + "'";
00329     return false;
00330   }
00331 
00332   Rule* rule = new Rule(name);  // XXX scoped_ptr
00333 
00334   if (tokenizer_.PeekToken() == Token::INDENT) {
00335     tokenizer_.ConsumeToken();
00336 
00337     while (tokenizer_.PeekToken() != Token::OUTDENT) {
00338       SourceLocation let_loc = tokenizer_.Location();
00339 
00340       string key;
00341       if (!ParseLetKey(&key, err))
00342         return false;
00343 
00344       EvalString* eval_target = NULL;
00345       if (key == "command") {
00346         eval_target = &rule->command_;
00347       } else if (key == "depfile") {
00348         eval_target = &rule->depfile_;
00349       } else if (key == "description") {
00350         eval_target = &rule->description_;
00351       } else {
00352         // Die on other keyvals for now; revisit if we want to add a
00353         // scope here.
00354         return let_loc.Error("unexpected variable '" + key + "'", err);
00355       }
00356 
00357       if (!ParseLetValue(eval_target, err))
00358         return false;
00359     }
00360     tokenizer_.ConsumeToken();
00361   }
00362 
00363   if (rule->command_.unparsed().empty())
00364     return tokenizer_.Error("expected 'command =' line", err);
00365 
00366   state_->AddRule(rule);
00367   return true;
00368 }
00369 
00370 bool ManifestParser::ParseLet(string* key, string* value, string* err) {
00371   if (!ParseLetKey(key, err))
00372     return false;
00373 
00374   EvalString eval;
00375   if (!ParseLetValue(&eval, err))
00376     return false;
00377 
00378   *value = eval.Evaluate(env_);
00379 
00380   return true;
00381 }
00382 
00383 bool ManifestParser::ParseLetKey(string* key, string* err) {
00384   if (!tokenizer_.ReadIdent(key))
00385     return tokenizer_.ErrorExpected("variable name", err);
00386   if (!tokenizer_.ExpectToken(Token::EQUALS, err))
00387     return false;
00388   return true;
00389 }
00390 
00391 bool ManifestParser::ParseLetValue(EvalString* eval, string* err) {
00392   // Backup the tokenizer state prior to consuming the line, for reporting
00393   // the source location in case of a parse error later.
00394   Tokenizer tokenizer_backup = tokenizer_;
00395 
00396   // XXX should we tokenize here?  it means we'll need to understand
00397   // command syntax, though...
00398   string value;
00399   if (!tokenizer_.ReadToNewline(&value, err))
00400     return false;
00401 
00402   string eval_err;
00403   size_t err_index;
00404   if (!eval->Parse(value, &eval_err, &err_index)) {
00405     value.clear();
00406     // Advance the saved tokenizer state up to the error index to report the
00407     // error at the correct source location.
00408     tokenizer_backup.ReadToNewline(&value, err, err_index);
00409     return tokenizer_backup.Error(eval_err, err);
00410   }
00411 
00412   return true;
00413 }
00414 
00415 bool ManifestParser::ParseEdge(string* err) {
00416   vector<string> ins, outs;
00417 
00418   if (!tokenizer_.ExpectIdent("build", err))
00419     return false;
00420 
00421   for (;;) {
00422     if (tokenizer_.PeekToken() == Token::COLON) {
00423       tokenizer_.ConsumeToken();
00424       break;
00425     }
00426 
00427     string out;
00428     if (!tokenizer_.ReadIdent(&out))
00429       return tokenizer_.ErrorExpected("output file list", err);
00430     outs.push_back(out);
00431   }
00432   // XXX check outs not empty
00433 
00434   string rule_name;
00435   if (!tokenizer_.ReadIdent(&rule_name))
00436     return tokenizer_.ErrorExpected("build command name", err);
00437 
00438   const Rule* rule = state_->LookupRule(rule_name);
00439   if (!rule)
00440     return tokenizer_.Error("unknown build rule '" + rule_name + "'", err);
00441 
00442   if (!rule->depfile_.empty()) {
00443     if (outs.size() > 1) {
00444       return tokenizer_.Error("dependency files only work with single-output "
00445                            "rules", err);
00446     }
00447   }
00448 
00449   for (;;) {
00450     string in;
00451     if (!tokenizer_.ReadIdent(&in))
00452       break;
00453     ins.push_back(in);
00454   }
00455 
00456   // Add all order-only deps, counting how many as we go.
00457   int implicit = 0;
00458   if (tokenizer_.PeekToken() == Token::PIPE) {
00459     tokenizer_.ConsumeToken();
00460     for (;;) {
00461       string in;
00462       if (!tokenizer_.ReadIdent(&in))
00463         break;
00464       ins.push_back(in);
00465       ++implicit;
00466     }
00467   }
00468 
00469   // Add all order-only deps, counting how many as we go.
00470   int order_only = 0;
00471   if (tokenizer_.PeekToken() == Token::PIPE2) {
00472     tokenizer_.ConsumeToken();
00473     for (;;) {
00474       string in;
00475       if (!tokenizer_.ReadIdent(&in))
00476         break;
00477       ins.push_back(in);
00478       ++order_only;
00479     }
00480   }
00481 
00482   if (!tokenizer_.Newline(err))
00483     return false;
00484 
00485   // Default to using outer env.
00486   BindingEnv* env = env_;
00487 
00488   // But use a nested env if there are variables in scope.
00489   if (tokenizer_.PeekToken() == Token::INDENT) {
00490     tokenizer_.ConsumeToken();
00491 
00492     // XXX scoped_ptr to handle error case.
00493     env = new BindingEnv;
00494     env->parent_ = env_;
00495     while (tokenizer_.PeekToken() != Token::OUTDENT) {
00496       string key, val;
00497       if (!ParseLet(&key, &val, err))
00498         return false;
00499       env->AddBinding(key, val);
00500     }
00501     tokenizer_.ConsumeToken();
00502   }
00503 
00504   // Evaluate all variables in paths.
00505   // XXX: fast path skip the eval parse if there's no $ in the path?
00506   vector<string>* paths[2] = { &ins, &outs };
00507   for (int p = 0; p < 2; ++p) {
00508     for (vector<string>::iterator i = paths[p]->begin();
00509          i != paths[p]->end(); ++i) {
00510       EvalString eval;
00511       string eval_err;
00512       if (!eval.Parse(*i, &eval_err))
00513         return tokenizer_.Error(eval_err, err);
00514       string path = eval.Evaluate(env);
00515       if (!CanonicalizePath(&path, err))
00516         return false;
00517       *i = path;
00518     }
00519   }
00520 
00521   Edge* edge = state_->AddEdge(rule);
00522   edge->env_ = env;
00523   for (vector<string>::iterator i = ins.begin(); i != ins.end(); ++i)
00524     state_->AddIn(edge, *i);
00525   for (vector<string>::iterator i = outs.begin(); i != outs.end(); ++i)
00526     state_->AddOut(edge, *i);
00527   edge->implicit_deps_ = implicit;
00528   edge->order_only_deps_ = order_only;
00529 
00530   return true;
00531 }
00532 
00533 bool ManifestParser::ParseFileInclude(string* err) {
00534   string type;
00535   tokenizer_.ReadIdent(&type);
00536 
00537   string path;
00538   if (!tokenizer_.ReadIdent(&path))
00539     return tokenizer_.ErrorExpected("path to ninja file", err);
00540 
00541   string contents;
00542   string read_err;
00543   if (!file_reader_->ReadFile(path, &contents, &read_err))
00544     return tokenizer_.Error("loading " + path + ": " + read_err, err);
00545 
00546   ManifestParser subparser(state_, file_reader_);
00547   if (type == "subninja") {
00548     // subninja: Construct a new scope for the new parser.
00549     subparser.env_ = new BindingEnv;
00550     subparser.env_->parent_ = env_;
00551   } else {
00552     // include: Reuse the current scope.
00553     subparser.env_ = env_;
00554   }
00555 
00556   string sub_err;
00557   if (!subparser.Parse(contents, &sub_err))
00558     return tokenizer_.Error("in '" + path + "': " + sub_err, err);
00559 
00560   if (!tokenizer_.Newline(err))
00561     return false;
00562 
00563   return true;
00564 }
